Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Configurators

Class ConfigApplier

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Configurators.ConfigApplier
Direct Known Subclasses:
CANCoderConfigApplier, Pigeon2ConfigApplier, TalonFXConfigApplier
public class ConfigApplier extends Object
Utility class for applying configuration settings to hardware devices with built-in retry logic. This helps ensure settings are reliably applied, especially when using Phoenix 6 motor controllers and devices.

  • Method Details

    • attempt

      protected static <Result> boolean attempt(Supplier<Result> applier, Function<Result,Boolean> isSuccess, int retries)
      Attempts to apply a configuration using a generic retry mechanism. Retries up to retries times until the isSuccess function returns true.
      Type Parameters:
      Result - the result type returned by the applier
      Parameters:
      applier - a Supplier that applies a configuration and returns a result
      isSuccess - a Function that checks if the result indicates success
      retries - the number of times to retry the application if unsuccessful
      Returns:
      true if the config was successfully applied within the given retries; false otherwise

    • attempt

      protected static boolean attempt(Supplier<StatusCode> applier)
      Attempts to apply a configuration that returns a StatusCode, retrying up to 10 times or until StatusCode.isOK() returns true.

      This is a Phoenix 6-specific convenience overload of the generic attempt(java.util.function.Supplier<Result>, java.util.function.Function<Result, java.lang.Boolean>, int) method.

      Parameters:
      applier - a Supplier that applies a config and returns a StatusCode
      Returns:
      true if the config was successfully applied; false otherwise
